itemDescription: English rugby union player and cricketer (1860-1941)

wikipedia_page.main: Alfred Teggin (22 October 1860 – 23 July 1941) was a rugby union footballer, and cricketer of the 1880s. He played representative level rugby union (RU) for England, and at club level for Broughton Rangers, as a forward, e.g. front row, lock, or back row, and county level cricket for Lancashire County Cricket Club.

response: * Alfred Teggin won caps for England (RU) while at Broughton Rangers in 1884 against Ireland, in 1885 against Wales, in 1886 against Ireland and Scotland, and in 1887 against Ireland, and Scotland
